Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Location”
Reviews.Author: tx515
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: This place is insanely close to so much! When we'd walk out the front entry and look right (West), you could see the entrance to Rockerfeller Center only several hundred yards away. Just past that was the iconic Radio City Music Hall sign. Directly across the street from the hotel was Bill's (GREAT burgers and of course beers). We walked to Broadway, Central Park and Times Square. We only took the transportation to a ballgame in NJ, to see the 9/11 Memorial and the Upper West Side. ROOM: It was very clean and spacious (for a NYC room). Had a very vintage, old NY feel to it (by this I don't mean it was nasty and run down...it was very well kept). If you want to stay the entire trip in the room, I'd say go somewhere else and pay 2-3 times as much. But this is perfect for the average traveler. STAFF: The entire staff was friendly, helpful and more than willing to point my wife and I to a great restaurant. OVERALL: I will not stay anywhere else from now on when I visit NYC. I was timid at first because of the price (roughly $220/nt compared to $400+/nt at other hotels in the area), but this place is where it's at.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & VALUE”
Reviews.Author: SCOUSERKelownaBc
Reviews.Content: Recommended to us by friends and we were not disappointed. Excellent location off 5th Avenue. We stayed for five nights--no issues. Older hotel but with character. Staff were excellent and very helpful. We walked just about everywhere on the trip--very reasonably priced for Manhattan.Added bonus is a Deli right next door for excellent food and service. Would definitely stay here again and have already recommended to fellow Canadians.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: catareenas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off 5th av and between rockeffeller centre and Moma, amazing location, within walking distance to times sq, central park, empire state, macys etc. The rooms are basic, a bit outdated and noisy but clean. We were only spending nights there so we didn't mind.pay cash, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and great value”
Reviews.Author: crowdhater
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of a package from the Uk and was great value. We only had two nights in New York and as it was our first visit, it was important to us that we were near to the main places. The hotel is just round the corner from the Rockafella centre and from here you can take the hop on hop off buses. We went to see Cirque du Soleil at the Radio City Hall which is 3 minutes walk from the hotel. Taxis run past the hotel all the time so are easy to catch if you need one. As for the hotel itself,our first impressions were good. The staff were very helpful and efficient. West Club is an old building which I personally found enchanting. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. However I do agree with the previous review that the air conditioning is old and noisy. It didn't bother me as it drowned out any traffic noise.however this could be a problem for light sleepers. There is a lovely restaurant ,ballroom and jazz nights were held every Wednesday when we were there. to sum it up,this was a great value small hotel in a superb location. Would I stay there again? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy and Musty”
Reviews.Author: nowthisdir
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff very nice, and the rooms are fairly large, but other than that, it's very mediocre. When we arrived, they couldn't find a bellman, but offered us the luggage rack. The lobby is tiny and looks like a relic of another age. When I opened the door of our room, it smelled so musty and moldy, we had to run the air conditioner for hours to make it tolerable. The clock was broken, we couldn't figure out how to work the tv, and the phone had no labeling to tell you which # to call for a particular service. For us, having a nice room is an important part of our stay anywhere. This is especially true for us in NYC, as we are both 'expats' and don't need to visit Rockefeller Center, etc. The meeting rooms are lovely and I wouldn't mind holding an event there, but that's not why we were there. Of course, I must say, it is precisely what I would expect from a hotel owned by a Republican women's club.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Devlin
Reviews.Content: For the price you're paying, you cannot beat this hotel in terms of location. Rockefeller Plaza, NBC, Radio City, St Patrick's, Saks Fifth etc. are literally just across the street! Times Square is a good 10minute walk. And if you're a tourist who will be out majority of the day, this is the place for you. Room and bath are basic. Don't expect the rooms to be fancy, because if you are, I suggest you skip this and just check in at any 4 or 5 star hotels nearby so there are no complaints. But if you're a budget-conscious traveller who'd like a basic "home base" to be right smack in the middle of Manhattan, this is where you should stay.

Reviews.Title: “all the good is true, but it is run by the the Women Republicans Club”
Reviews.Author: GratefulDave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good value, but many travelers may want to know that the hotel and profits go to the Women's Republican Club and there is promotional materials in the rooms and all over.. Some travelers, like me, may forgo the bargain because organization "promotes the position of the Republican Party." I don't want my money going to support their positions and wouldn't stay there again for that reason. Staff are great. Location is great. Rooms are a bit on the rough side ( loose outlets that was a building code violation in any state). AC Window unit was inadequate, in 90 plus heat. Hard to beat the value. N wireless, no business center.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint place in the heart of rockefeller center. Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: askewreasoning
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in June 2011 and were surprised. A diamond in the rough (not that rockefeller center is rough mind you). All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful except for the gentleman who works the overnight security, unwelcoming to say the least. We actually timed our excursions to end before his shift started so as not to see him). The rooms are cozy but clean and have air conditioners, albeit noisy, that work. The only turn offs were that there were no safes in the room or wi-fi. They offer free wired connection but nobody really travels with their laptops nowadays. We had our ipads which have no wired internet connection port so we had no internet. No real problem since we were on vacay but might put off business travelers and the front desk was gracious enough to let us use their computer from time to time. If you want a bang for your buck in a great location (walking distance to times square, st. patricks, central park) stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: krzastrm
Reviews.Content: Per the other reviews, the 3 west club is dated, but it is not dirty. You do not get all of the amenities that the luxuy hotels offer, but you are also not paying the luxury price. Our room was overlooking St Patricks Cathedral, was down the street from Radio City, and steps from 5th avenue. The had a free luggage check so we didn't have to be the travellers that carry their suitcases around on our last day, and the front desk was very friendly/informative. I have previously stayed in a couple 3.5/4* Times Square hotels, and from now on will be booking the 3 West Club.

Reviews.Title: “3 West Club is my home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: lena4766
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at 3 West Club in October, 2010 for my daughter's wedding. As a venue for an elegant, intimate, romantic wedding 3 West is simply extraordinary. We now stay there whenever we are in NY. The entire staff at 3 West is gracious, accommodating, professional, and courteous. 3 West is the eye of the hurricane that is NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: mksdad
Reviews.Content: I was rebooked into 3 west when the cool cats at the Jewel gave my room away the other night. Cannot say enough great things about the staff here. Everyone I came in contact with was helpful and went out of their way to make my brief stay better. Rooms are basic but for the location and the price, a real bargain. Had breakfast in the 2M pub and was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and the excellent service. Kudos to Maria Cristina, our waitress, she is some of the best advertising any hotel could ever ask for. This hotel also doubles as the national Women's republican club, so lots of great public rooms and good meeting space as well. I was booked at the Jewel but ended up at 3West. While the Jewel might have nicer rooms, it's people could learn a thing or two about hospitality from the folks at 3West. The people at 3 West actually appreciate your business, imagine that!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here for years, not a roach motel!”
Reviews.Author: luvnlife247
Reviews.Content: OK this is not the fanciest place, but the location can't be beat! Never seen any roaches there either! They have recently updated all of the rooms. They are somewhat small, decorated simply, and are perfectly clean. I have recommended this place to friends over the years, & have gotten no complaints. It is not a big hotel. Has 2 elevators that work just fine. Restaurant in the place is good for dinner too. The location is perfect, right off 5th Ave. If you want fancy then this might not be for you. Personally, I don't come to NYC to stay in my room. As long as the room & bathroom are clean I am good. I have found that both are, and have been, in the years I have choosen to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and a great little find!”
Reviews.Author: AmberE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 3 West Club in October 2008. It was a steal based on the location. We had been looking for weeks and could find nothing available that fit our budget. We had a group of 4 adults and 2 children (4&7). We had the king suite and it was massive. There is a king size bed, a double pull-out (that was fairly comfortable) and they brought up a roll away for our oldest (our little one shared the king with my hubby and I). So romance it was not, but for our group it was perfect. There were three closets - one in the bathroom, one in the hall and then one in a dressing area off the hall. The staff was always helpful and friendly. It was also very clean. This is not your typical chain hotel though. If your looking for room service, or some of the other amenities that major hotels provide, then this is probably not the place for you. If you want be able to walk out the front door and cross the street to Rockefeller Center, but you're still budget conscience - this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: toltecs
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the 3 West Club on a Wednesday and Thursday night (June 18-19). I used this hotel as a backup while I was trying to get a cheaper hotel on priceline. As luck would have it, there was no inventory mid-week on priceline for our dates, so we ended up staying here. For some reason, prices for that week appeared higher than usual for NYC. As a result, the 3 West Club was one of the better bargains I could get at $214 per night ($247 w/tax) without a long list of negative reviews and scary stories. We were, however, a little hesitant because there were so few reviews, and we could find no other information about the hotel, even on their website. But, we decided to take a chance. Our flight to NYC was very delayed, so I called the hotel and told them we would be very late. They said not to worry, that they would never give a hotel room away when we had a reservation. We ended up arriving at about 3 AM, and they had a room waiting for us. We had a room overlooking W 51st Street on the seventh floor. If you are a light sleeper, the noise from the street could be a problem. We were so tired each night that it really didn't bother us too much, and I am a light sleeper. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised with the room at that price. If you are looking for luxury, services and amenities in a hotel, I don't think this is the place for you. However, if you need a decent, clean room in an excellent location, this is it. The room was not too small, had a good-sized closet, a decent shower, and a flat panel LCD TV with digital cable and tons of channels. At the time we were there, there was scaffolding on the front of the building, but that really didn't bother us - we didn't notice any active work (i.e., noise from construction) going on while we were there. Through the scaffolding, we could see Rockefeller Center across the street and St. Patrick's Cathedral on the corner. The excellent location of this hotel can't be overstated if you are there to visit many of the tourist attractions. In comparison to the other hotels that were available at this price, I think the 3 West Club is a great deal. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location....location....location!”
Reviews.Author: BTDT115
Reviews.Content: Shhhhh - don't tell EVERYONE about the BEST hotel secret in NYC. Then we'll never be able to get rooms there ! If you need fancy rooms and high tech everything, don't waste your time. But if you are looking for value and location - you can't beat it. And if you are a Republican - well - it's the cat's pajamas!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle”
Reviews.Author: sirwilliam205
Reviews.Content: Best location in New York City. Right near St. Patricks, RockafellowCenter and many good restaurants. Theatre is a short walk. We'll be back this year.

HotelInfo.Name: 3 West Club
HotelInfo.Address: 3 West 51st St, New York City, NY 10019
